intro: Oldenlandia rhodesiana, commonly known as the Rhodes spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a trailing habit, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and wiry. The plant is also known for its ability to thrive in sandy or well-drained soils.
